member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HidUsagesConsumer
member.summary: The different consumer HID usages See here

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HidUsagesGeneric
member.summary: The different known generic HID usages See here

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HidUsagePages
member.summary: The different known HID usage pages

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes
member.summary: The type of hook procedure to be installed via the SetWindowsHookEx function. This parameter can be one of the following values:

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_MSGFILTER
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors messages generated as a result of an input event in a dialog box, message box, menu, or scroll bar. For more information, see the MessageProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_JOURNALRECORD
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that records input messages posted to the system message queue. This hook is useful for recording macros. For more information, see the JournalRecordProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that posts messages previously recorded by a WH_JOURNALRECORD hook procedure. For more information, see the JournalPlaybackProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_KEYBOARD
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors keystroke messages. For more information, see the KeyboardProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_GETMESSAGE
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors messages posted to a message queue. For more information, see the GetMsgProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_CALLWNDPROC
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors messages before the system sends them to the destination window procedure. For more information, see the CallWndProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_CBT
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that receives notifications useful to a CBT application. For more information, see the CBTProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_SYSMSGFILTER
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors messages generated as a result of an input event in a dialog box, message box, menu, or scroll bar. The hook procedure monitors these messages for all applications in the same desktop as the calling thread. For more information, see the SysMsgProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_MOUSE
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors mouse messages. For more information, see the MouseProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_HARDWARE
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors hardware messages. For more information, see the HardwareProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_DEBUG
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure useful for debugging other hook procedures. For more information, see the DebugProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_SHELL
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that receives notifications useful to shell applications. For more information, see the ShellProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_FOREGROUNDIDLE
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that will be called when the application's foreground thread is about to become idle. This hook is useful for performing low priority tasks during idle time. For more information, see the ForegroundIdleProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_CALLWNDPROCRET
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors messages after they have been processed by the destination window procedure. For more information, see the CallWndRetProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_KEYBOARD_LL
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors low-level keyboard input events. For more information, see the LowLevelKeyboardProc hook procedure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.HookTypes.WH_MOUSE_LL
member.summary: Installs a hook procedure that monitors low-level mouse input events. For more information, see the LowLevelMouseProc hook procedure

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseButtonStates
member.summary: The transition state of the mouse buttons. This member can be one or more of the following values. See RAWMOUSE structure

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseButtonStates.Wheel
member.summary: Raw input comes from a mouse wheel. The wheel delta is stored in usButtonData.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseStates
member.summary: The mouse state. This member can be any reasonable combination of the following. See RAWMOUSE structure

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseStates.MoveRelative
member.summary: Mouse movement data is relative to the last mouse position.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseStates.MoveAbsolute
member.summary: Mouse movement data is based on absolute position.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseStates.VirtualDesktop
member.summary: Mouse coordinates are mapped to the virtual desktop (for a multiple monitor system).

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags
member.summary: Mode flag that specifies how to interpret the information provided by usUsagePage and usUsage. It can be zero (the default) or one of the following values. By default, the operating system sends raw input from devices with the specified top level collection (TLC) to the registered application as long as it has the window focus. See RAWINPUTDEVICE structure

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.Remove
member.summary: RIDEV_REMOVE: If set, this removes the top level collection from the inclusion list. This tells the operating system to stop reading from a device which matches the top level collection.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.Exclude
member.summary: RIDEV_EXCLUDE: If set, this specifies the top level collections to exclude when reading a complete usage page. This flag only affects a TLC whose usage page is already specified with RIDEV_PAGEONLY.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.PageOnly
member.summary: RIDEV_PAGEONLY: If set, this specifies all devices whose top level collection is from the specified usUsagePage. Note that usUsage must be zero. To exclude a particular top level collection, use RIDEV_EXCLUDE.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoLegacy
member.summary: RIDEV_NOLEGACY: If set, this prevents any devices specified by usUsagePage or usUsage from generating legacy messages. This is only for the mouse and keyboard. See Remarks.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.InputSink
member.summary: RIDEV_INPUTSINK: If set, this enables the caller to receive the input even when the caller is not in the foreground. Note that hwndTarget must be specified.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoHotkeys
member.summary: RIDEV_NOHOTKEYS: If set, the application-defined keyboard device hotkeys are not handled. However, the system hotkeys; for example, ALT+TAB and CTRL+ALT+DEL, are still handled. By default, all keyboard hotkeys are handled. RIDEV_NOHOTKEYS can be specified even if RIDEV_NOLEGACY is not specified and hwndTarget is NULL.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.CaptureMouse
member.summary: RIDEV_CAPTUREMOUSE: If set, the mouse button click does not activate the other window.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.AppKeys
member.summary: RIDEV_APPKEYS: If set, the application command keys are handled. RIDEV_APPKEYS can be specified only if RIDEV_NOLEGACY is specified for a keyboard device.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.ExInputSink
member.summary: RIDEV_EXINPUTSINK: If set, this enables the caller to receive input in the background only if the foreground application does not process it. In other words, if the foreground application is not registered for raw input, then the background application that is registered will receive the input. Windows XP: This flag is not supported until Windows Vista

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceFlags.DeviceNotify
member.summary: RIDEV_DEVNOTIFY: If set, this enables the caller to receive WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE notifications for device arrival and device removal. Windows XP: This flag is not supported until Windows Vista

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.InputTypes
member.summary: An enum specifying the type of input event used for the SendInput call. This specifies which structure type of the union supplied to SendInput is used. See INPUT structure

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.InputTypes.Mouse
member.summary: The event is a mouse event.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.InputTypes.Keyboard
member.summary: The event is a keyboard event.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.InputTypes.Hardware
member.summary: The event is a hardware event.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceInfoCommands.DeviceInfo

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceInfoCommands.PreparsedData
member.summary: pData points to the previously parsed data.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDataCommands.Header
member.summary: RID_HEADER: Get the header information from the RAWINPUT structure.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceTypes.Mouse
member.summary: RIM_TYPEMOUSE: Specified device is a mouse

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDeviceTypes.HID

member.summary: Pointer UsagePage: 0x01 Usage: 0x05 Hardware ID: HID_DEVICE_SYSTEM_GAME

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.RawInputDevices.Keypad
member.summary: Pointer UsagePage: 0x01 Usage: 0x07 Hardware ID: HID_DEVICE_SYSTEM_KEYBOARD

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes
member.summary: Symbolic constant names, hexadecimal values, and mouse or keyboard equivalents for the virtual-key codes used by the system. The codes are listed in numeric order. See Virtual-Key Codes

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.F22
member.summary: F22 key, (PPC only) Key used to lock device.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.BROWSER_HOME
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Browser Start and Home key

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_1
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_PLUS
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: For any country/region, the '+' key

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_COMMA
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: For any country/region, the ',' key

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_MINUS
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: For any country/region, the '-' key

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_PERIOD
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: For any country/region, the '.' key

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_2
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_3
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_4
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_5
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_6
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_7
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_8
member.summary: Used for miscellaneous characters; it can vary by keyboard.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.OEM_102
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Either the angle bracket key or the backslash key on the RT 102-key keyboard

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.PROCESSKEY
member.summary: Windows 95/98/Me, Windows NT 4.0, Windows 2000/XP: IME PROCESS key

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes.PACKET
member.summary: Windows 2000/XP: Used to pass Unicode characters as if they were keystrokes. The VK_PACKET key is the low word of a 32-bit Virtual Key value used for non-keyboard input methods. For more information, see Remark in KEYBDINPUT, SendInput, WM_KEYDOWN, and WM_KEYUP

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.ExtendedKeyFlags
member.summary: The extended-key flag, event-injected flags, context code, and transition-state flag. This member is specified as follows. An application can use the following values to test the keystroke flags. Testing LLKHF_INJECTED (bit 4) will tell you whether the event was injected. If it was, then testing LLKHF_LOWER_IL_INJECTED (bit 1) will tell you whether or not the event was injected from a process running at lower integrity level.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.ExtendedKeyFlags.LowerIntegretyInjected
member.summary: Test the event-injected (from a process running at lower integrity level) flag.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.ExtendedKeyFlags.Injected
member.summary: Test the event-injected (from any process) flag.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.ExtendedMouseFlags
member.summary: The event-injected flags. An application can use the following values to test the flags. Testing LLMHF_INJECTED (bit 0) will tell you whether the event was injected. If it was, then testing LLMHF_LOWER_IL_INJECTED (bit 1) will tell you whether or not the event was injected from a process running at lower integrity level.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.ExtendedMouseFlags.Injected
member.summary: Test the event-injected (from any process) flag.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.ExtendedMouseFlags.LowerIntegretyInjected
member.summary: Test the event-injected (from a process running at lower integrity level) flag.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseEventFlags
member.summary: A set of bit flags that specify various aspects of mouse motion and button clicks. The bits in this member can be any reasonable combination of the following values. The bit flags that specify mouse button status are set to indicate changes in status, not ongoing conditions. For example, if the left mouse button is pressed and held down, MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTDOWN is set when the left button is first pressed, but not for subsequent motions. Similarly, MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTUP is set only when the button is first released. You cannot specify both the MOUSEEVENTF_WHEEL flag and either MOUSEEVENTF_XDOWN or MOUSEEVENTF_XUP flags simultaneously in the dwFlags parameter, because they both require use of the mouseData field. See

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseEventFlags.Wheel
member.summary: The wheel was moved, if the mouse has a wheel. The amount of movement is specified in mouseData.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseEventFlags.HorizontalWheel
member.summary: The wheel was moved horizontally, if the mouse has a wheel. The amount of movement is specified in mouseData. Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseEventFlags.MoveNocoalesce
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEMOVE messages will not be coalesced. The default behavior is to coalesce WM_MOUSEMOVE messages. Windows XP/2000: This value is not supported.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseEventFlags.Virtualdesk
member.summary: Maps coordinates to the entire desktop. Must be used with MOUSEEVENTF_ABSOLUTE.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.MouseEventFlags.Absolute
member.summary: The dx and dy members contain normalized absolute coordinates. If the flag is not set, dxand dy contain relative data (the change in position since the last reported position). This flag can be set, or not set, regardless of what kind of mouse or other pointing device, if any, is connected to the system. For further information about relative mouse motion, see the following Remarks section.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.KeyEventFlags
member.summary: This enum specifies various aspects of a keystroke. This member can be certain combinations of the following values. See KEYBDINPUT structure

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.KeyEventFlags.ExtendedKey
member.summary: If specified, the scan code was preceded by a prefix byte that has the value 0xE0 (224).

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.KeyEventFlags.KeyUp
member.summary: If specified, the key is being released. If not specified, the key is being pressed.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.KeyEventFlags.Unicode
member.summary: If specified, the system synthesizes a VK_PACKET keystroke. The VirtualKeyCode parameter must be zero. This flag can only be combined with the KeyUp flag. For more information, see the Remarks section.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.KeyEventFlags.Scancode
member.summary: If specified, wScan identifies the key and VirtualKeyCode is ignored.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.InputGenerator.SendInput(System.UInt32,Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.Input[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Synthesizes keystrokes, mouse motions, and button clicks. The function returns the number of events that it successfully inserted into the keyboard or mouse input stream. If the function returns zero, the input was already blocked by another thread. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.MapVkType.VkToVsc
member.summary: The uCode parameter is a virtual-key code and is translated into a scan code. If it is a virtual-key code that does not distinguish between left- and right-hand keys, the left-hand scan code is returned. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.MapVkType.VscToVk
member.summary: The uCode parameter is a scan code and is translated into a virtual-key code that does not distinguish between left- and right-hand keys. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.MapVkType.VkToChar
member.summary: The uCode parameter is a virtual-key code and is translated into an unshifted character value in the low order word of the return value. Dead keys (diacritics) are indicated by setting the top bit of the return value. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.MapVkType.VscToVkEx
member.summary: The uCode parameter is a scan code and is translated into a virtual-key code that distinguishes between left- and right-hand keys. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.MapVkType.VkToVscEx
member.summary: The uCode parameter is a virtual-key code and is translated into a scan code. If it is a virtual-key code that does not distinguish between left- and right-hand keys, the left-hand scan code is returned. If the scan code is an extended scan code, the high byte of the uCode value can contain either 0xe0 or 0xe1 to specify the extended scan code. If there is no translation, the function returns 0.

Consumer Usage for the raw input device.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.RawInputApi.RegisterRawInput(Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDevice[])
member.summary: Register to handle RawInput events Note: To receive WM_INPUT messages, an application must first register the raw input devices using RegisterRawInputDevices. By default, an application does not receive raw input. To receive WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE messages, an application must specify the RIDEV_DEVNOTIFY flag for each device class that is specified by the usUsagePage and usUsage fields of the RAWINPUTDEVICE structure . By default, an application does not receive WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE notifications for raw input device arrival and removal. If a RAWINPUTDEVICE structure has the RIDEV_REMOVE flag set and the hwndTarget parameter is not set to NULL, then parameter validation will fail.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.RawInputApi.GetDeviceInformation(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieve RawInputDeviceInformation on the by the handle specified RawInput device This is used when calling GetAllDevices, but can also be called when getting a WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE message
member.param: IntPtr handle to the raw input device

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.RawInputApi.GetAllDevices
member.summary: A convenient function for getting all raw input devices. This method will get all devices, including virtual devices- For remote desktop and any other device driver that's registered as such a device.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawMouse.Y
member.summary: The motion in the Y direction. This is signed relative motion or absolute motion, depending on the value of usFlags.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputHeader.Type
member.summary: Type of raw input (RIM_TYPEHID 2, RIM_TYPEKEYBOARD 1, RIM_TYPEMOUSE 0)

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfo
member.summary: This structdefines the raw input data coming from any device. See RID_DEVICE_INFO structure Remarks:

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoHID
member.summary: This struct defines the raw input data coming from the specified keyboard. See RID_DEVICE_INFO_KEYBOARD structure Remarks: For the keyboard, the Usage Page is 1 and the Usage is 6.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoHID.Usage

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoKeyboard
member.summary: This struct defines the raw input data coming from the specified keyboard. See RID_DEVICE_INFO_KEYBOARD structure Remarks: For the keyboard, the Usage Page is 1 and the Usage is 6.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoKeyboard.NumberOfFunctionKeys

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoMouse.Id
member.summary: The identifier of the mouse device.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoMouse.NumberOfButtons
member.summary: The number of buttons for the mouse.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoMouse.SampleRate
member.summary: The number of data points per second. This information may not be applicable for every mouse device.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceInfoMouse.HasHorizontalWheel
member.summary: TRUE if the mouse has a wheel for horizontal scrolling; otherwise, FALSE. Windows XP: This member is only supported starting with Windows Vista.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceList
member.summary: Contains information about a raw input device. See RAWINPUTDEVICELIST structure

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDeviceList.Handle
member.summary: A handle to the raw input device.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDevice
member.summary: This struct contains information about a raw input device. See RAWINPUTDEVICE structure Remarks: If RIDEV_NOLEGACY is set for a mouse or a keyboard, the system does not generate any legacy message for that device for the application. For example, if the mouse TLC is set with RIDEV_NOLEGACY, WM_LBUTTONDOWN and related legacy mouse messages are not generated. Likewise, if the keyboard TLC is set with RIDEV_NOLEGACY, WM_KEYDOWN and related legacy keyboard messages are not generated. If RIDEV_REMOVE is set and the hwndTarget member is not set to NULL, then parameter validation will fail.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDevice.UsagePage
member.summary: Top level collection Usage page for the raw input device.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDevice.Usage
member.summary: Top level collection Usage for the raw input device.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDevice.Flags
member.summary: Mode flag that specifies how to interpret the information provided by usUsagePage and usUsage. It can be zero (the default) or one of the following values. By default, the operating system sends raw input from devices with the specified top level collection (TLC) to the registered application as long as it has the window focus.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.RawInputDevice.TargetHwnd
member.summary: A handle to the target window. If NULL it follows the keyboard focus.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput
member.summary: Contains information about a simulated mouse event. See MOUSEINPUT structure

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.dx
member.summary: The absolute position of the mouse, or the amount of motion since the last mouse event was generated, depending on the value of the dwFlags member. Absolute data is specified as the x coordinate of the mouse; relative data is specified as the number of pixels moved.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.dy
member.summary: The absolute position of the mouse, or the amount of motion since the last mouse event was generated, depending on the value of the dwFlags member. Absolute data is specified as the y coordinate of the mouse; relative data is specified as the number of pixels moved.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.MouseData
member.summary: If dwFlags contains MOUSEEVENTF_WHEEL, then mouseData specifies the amount of wheel movement. A positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated forward, away from the user; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated backward, toward the user. One wheel click is defined as WHEEL_DELTA, which is 120. Windows Vista: If dwFlags contains MOUSEEVENTF_HWHEEL, then dwData specifies the amount of wheel movement. A positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated to the right; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated to the left. One wheel click is defined as WHEEL_DELTA, which is 120. If dwFlags does not contain MOUSEEVENTF_WHEEL, MOUSEEVENTF_XDOWN, or MOUSEEVENTF_XUP, then mouseData should be zero. If dwFlags contains MOUSEEVENTF_XDOWN or MOUSEEVENTF_XUP, then mouseData specifies which X buttons were pressed or released. This value may be any combination of the following flags: XBUTTON1 0x0001 Set if the first X button is pressed or released. XBUTTON2 0x0002 Set if the second X button is pressed or released.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.MouseEventFlags
member.summary: A set of bit flags that specify various aspects of mouse motion and button clicks. The bits in this member can be any reasonable combination of the following values.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.Timestamp
member.summary: The time stamp for the event, in milliseconds. If this parameter is 0, the system will provide its own time stamp.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.dwExtraInfo
member.summary: An additional value associated with the mouse event. An application calls GetMessageExtraInfo to obtain this extra information.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.RemapLocation(Dapplo.Windows.Common.Structs.NativePoint)
member.summary: The coordinates need to be mapped from 0-65535 where 0 is left and 65535 is right

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.MoveMouseWheel(System.Int32,System.Nullable{Dapplo.Windows.Common.Structs.NativePoint},System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a MouseInput struct for a wheel move
member.param: How much does the wheel move
The time stamp for the event

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.MouseMove(Dapplo.Windows.Common.Structs.NativePoint,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a MouseInput struct for a mouse move
member.param: The time stamp for the event

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.MouseDown(System.Windows.Forms.MouseButtons,System.Nullable{Dapplo.Windows.Common.Structs.NativePoint},System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a MouseInput struct for a mouse button down
member.param: MouseButtons to specify which mouse buttons
The time stamp for the event

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseInput.MouseUp(System.Windows.Forms.MouseButtons,System.Nullable{Dapplo.Windows.Common.Structs.NativePoint},System.UInt32)
member.summary: Create a MouseInput struct for a mouse button up
member.param: MouseButtons to specify which mouse buttons
The time stamp for the event

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseLowLevelHookStruct
member.summary: This struct is passed in the WH_MOUSE_LL hook See: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ms644970.aspx

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseLowLevelHookStruct.pt
member.summary: The x- and y-coordinates of the cursor, in per-monitor-aware screen coordinates.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseLowLevelHookStruct.MouseData
member.summary: If the message is WM_MOUSEWHEEL, the high-order word of this member is the wheel delta. The low-order word is reserved. A positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated forward, away from the user; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated backward, toward the user. One wheel click is defined as WHEEL_DELTA, which is 120. If the message is WM_XBUTTONDOWN, WM_XBUTTONUP, WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK, WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN, WM_NCXBUTTONUP, or WM_NCXBUTTONDBLCLK, the high-order word specifies which X button was pressed or released, and the low-order word is reserved. This value can be one or more of the following values. Otherwise, mouseData is not used.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseLowLevelHookStruct.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time stamp for this message.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.MouseLowLevelHookStruct.dwExtraInfo
member.summary: Additional information associated with the message.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput
member.summary: This struct contains information about a simulated keyboard event. See KEYBDINPUT structure

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.VirtualKeyCode
member.summary: A virtual-key code. The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254. If the dwFlags member specifies KEYEVENTF_UNICODE, wVk must be 0.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.ScanCode
member.summary: A hardware scan code for the key. If KeyEventFlags specifies Unicode, ScanCode specifies a Unicode character which is to be sent to the foreground application.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.KeyEventFlags
member.summary: Specifies various aspects of a keystroke. This member can be certain combinations of the following values.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.Timestamp
member.summary: The time stamp for the event, in milliseconds. If this parameter is zero, the system will provide its own time stamp.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.ExtraInfo
member.summary: An additional value associated with the keystroke. Use the GetMessageExtraInfo function to obtain this information.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.ForKeyPress(Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a KeyboardInput for a key press (up / down)

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.ForKeyDown(Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a KeyboardInput for a key down

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput.ForKeyUp(Dapplo.Windows.Input.Enums.VirtualKeyCodes,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a KeyboardInput for a key up

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardLowLevelHookStruct
member.summary: Contains information about a low-level keyboard input event. See KBDLLHOOKSTRUCT structure

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardLowLevelHookStruct.VirtualKeyCode
member.summary: A virtual-key code. The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardLowLevelHookStruct.ScanCode
member.summary: A hardware scan code for the key.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardLowLevelHookStruct.Flags
member.summary: The extended-key flag, event-injected flags, context code, and transition-state flag. This member is specified as follows. An application can use the following values to test the keystroke flags. Testing LLKHF_INJECTED (bit 4) will tell you whether the event was injected. If it was, then testing LLKHF_LOWER_IL_INJECTED (bit 1) will tell you whether or not the event was injected from a process running at lower integrity level.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardLowLevelHookStruct.TimeStamp
member.summary: The time stamp for this message, equivalent to what GetMessageTime would return for this message.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardLowLevelHookStruct.ExtraInfo
member.summary: Additional information associated with the message.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.HardwareInput
member.summary: Contains information about a simulated message generated by an input device other than a keyboard or mouse. See HARDWAREINPUT structure

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.HardwareInput.uMsg
member.summary: The message generated by the input hardware.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.HardwareInput.ParamL
member.summary: The low-order word of the lParam parameter for uMsg.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.HardwareInput.wParamH
member.summary: The high-order word of the lParam parameter for uMsg.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.Input
member.summary: A struct used by SendInput to store information for synthesizing input events such as keystrokes, mouse movement, and mouse clicks. See INPUT structure

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.Input.InputType
member.summary: The type of the input event. This member can be one of the following values.

member.name: F:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.Input.InputUnion
member.summary: A union which contains the MouseInput, KeyboardInput or HardwareInput

member.summary: A factory method to simplify creating mouse input

member.name: M:Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.Input.CreateKeyboardInputs(Dapplo.Windows.Input.Structs.KeyboardInput[])
member.summary: A factory method to simplify creating input

member.summary: Used as the Size in the SendInput call

member.summary: A "union" containing a specific input struct

member.summary: Assign this if the input is MouseInput
